page.title: 02Plough and Harrow Litlington
page.content: The Plough and Harrow public house in Litlington is a popular eating and drinking centre for local people, passing motorists, holiday visitors and many walkers and cyclists.It has a large car park - an essential amenity as the pub itself abuts the main road through the village.At the far end of the car park a footpath leads to a bridge over the River Cuckmere.Towing paths are provided in each direction so that walkers can reach Alfriston or Exceat in pleasant rural surroundings. The pub is 600 years old and was originally two farm cottages linked with existing dwellings.The original, large open fireplace is still used. Until 1961 the pub was owned by a brewery but after extensive modernisation it became a Free House. This means that it is owned and managed by the resident proprietor.
